name: Stonybrook Motel & Lodge

reviews.text: We stayed in the lodge, which is adorable. My DH doesn't like motels in general so I made sure we had a lodge room...when they realized we were traveling with 3 children, they upgraded us to a bigger room. The towels were worn but clean and the room was spacious.
reviews.title: Would come back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The owners were very helpful with restaurant suggestions and it is close to Franconia Notch. There's an indoor pool which is very clean but is FREEZING. My older two got in but the baby said no way. Ok, he screamed and I took that as no way.
reviews.title: Nice & Lovely Property

reviews.text: I loved the lodge because of the woodwork but if you have bad knees or very heavy luggage, be warned that there's no elevator and it is a little steep on the stairs.
reviews.title: Nice place and great hospitality

likes.disliked: — Telephones hardly work in that area

reviews.text: I think this would be awesome in the winter but it is very nice in the summer too. They keep the grounds beautiful.
reviews.title: Friendly People

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A lovely property set back in a peaceful location with a large, well maintained sunny area for enjoying the beautiful outdoors. ..located very close to all attractions.. The rooms clean and well stocked...A wide selection of movies are available for watching in the privacy of your room. In the morning there is a fresh selection of breakfast items..along with coffee, tea and juice. The owners make this experience warm, friendly and very welcoming. They care deeply for their property..and the love abounds...from fragrant flowers, lush lawn, relaxing pool to the breathtaking views... A most wonderful experience...simply perfect.
reviews.title: Friendly and Clean

reviews.text: Do you remember when staying at a motel where you were treated with care and felt like you were visiting some old friends. This was the experience I had the very first time I stayed here. Family run and it shows. Service the old fashion way and very fair priced.
reviews.title: True value and incredible views

reviews.text: The location is perfect as well. Incredible views of Cannon Mt. and Mt. Lafayette. You can put on your skiboots here and be on Cannon Mt. in 5 minutes.
reviews.title: a great place to bring the family

reviews.text: I will be back!
reviews.title: Great little place

reviews.text: Just returned from staying 3 nights at the Stonybrook Lodge with the family and was very happy with our choice. We picked it out of the blue online but were comforted by all the positive reviews we found on this side. The location was great for our plans to ski since it's only a few miles to Cannon Mt and about a 30 minute drive to Bretton Woods. As noted by everyone else on this site, the lodge is clean and the owners Tom and Pauline are very pleasant hosts. They have a nice indoor pool which the kids love and a great common room for relaxing by the fireplace and chatting with the other guests. This place is a great bargain and super alternative to staying at some boring old hotel/motel chain.
reviews.title: this place is great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've stayed here a couple times now, and have never had a complaint. Close to Cannon, and a wonderful proprietor who is a font of knowledge of the area (and whose son originally suggested we try the excellent Cantina di Gerardo). The TVs even have a good selection of common channels to watch if you're tired-out from a day of skiing, or relaxing after using the pool.
reviews.title: What a Beautiful Getaway

likes.disliked: — The room was small, but cozy!

reviews.title: Wonderful place to stay
reviews.text: We traveled with 3 other couples to New England this past Sept. and I was in charge of trip arrangements. It is always nice to find a place with an area that the 8 of us can get together to talk, play games and make plans for the next day and this lodge was perfect for that. The indoor pool is great and the owners went out of their way in making a warm fire for us each night. If you are looking for a warm friendly place to stay this is it. We even saw a mother bear and cubs both evenings we were there. You can't go wrong staying here.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you like a quiet get-a-way in a quaint town with a beautiful backdrop then look no further. This has it all. First off, Pauline & Tom are the pefect hosts. Anything they can do help is what they do. From the little touches in the room to the campfire everynight this has it all.
reviews.title: Piece & tranquillity

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For the romantic it is heaven, but plenty for the whole family. Near so many interesting places for every taste.
reviews.title: Perfect Spot in Franconia!

reviews.text: We needed this vacation and Stonybrook fit the bill. Besides we were here during wonderful weather just in time to see the bright autumn leaves.
reviews.title: a great place to just relax and injoy the views

likes.liked: — the rooms and the 2 pools , fire place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We planned a mini-vacation for the White Mountains. Our mission: TO CLIMB MOUNT WASHINGTON! We need a place to stay and have been going to this area of NH for 30+ years. Normally we stay at another place, however, we need a change! We stumbled upon STONEY BROOK and it had good curb appear....flowers, nicely painted, well kept. When we went into the office and where met by both owners they were very friendly and the price was affordable we decided to stay. Perks: there's two pools, an inside heated and an outside pool. The views around are fabulous! We planned on staying 1 nite and stayed 2! Climbed up Mount Washington as planned.....There's a whole other story! BOTTOM LINE......WE'LL BE COMING BACK NEXT YEAR! It was a nice place to stay!
reviews.title: A very friendly, peaceful and relaxing hotel!!

reviews.text: We had honeymooned here 26 years ago so we returned this time with our son and my mom we got two rooms. The place has basically stayed unchanged except for the owners. I suspect that 'Mike" has inherited his name from the previous owners and Kelly was a no show, however the elderly couple who cleans could possibly be the parents of Mike, all very nice and hardworking. We stayed in the Lodge which is the main building, the five rooms are all upstairs (no elevator) and the recreational area is downstairs. The inside is all log and you really get the feel of being in a Lodge, however the place is of course worn. The game room is comfy and gives you a nice place to hang out if you are with family or friends, we picked up and ate pizza there, played pool, and sat around the large built in fireplace which was not in use that early in the season. The board games are kept in built in bins/seats, are all old and we were afraid to touch them and they didn't look complete as if some were missing, we saw pictionary.The bedrooms are very clean and the bathroom is spotless. Don't expect new and updated furniture or amenities it's just not a hotel. Bring your own toiletries as you only get conditioning shampoo and slivers of soap. There is a coffeemaker and a small fridge, our clothes drawer fell out when we pulled it out . The breakfast is basic, bagels, sweet pastries and cereal, the juice was Tang and they had coffee and tea. The indoor pool felt warm to the touch the day before but the next day when we got in it was COLD, the outdoor pool stayed closed even though it was the labor day weekend and it is supposed to be heated. The motel is comfortable seemingly on par with the other motels in the area. For breakfast everyone wants to try Polly's pancake house which is not far away but was too crowded and had a long wait, so if you miss the 9:30 cut off time at Stonybrook we would highly recommend the breakfast at the Best Western on Wallace Hill Rd, it's inexpensive and good, we went twice. Stonybrook is in a great location if you are going to see the Franconia Notch attractions they are 5 minutes away. One day we saw a baby bear cub near the side of the road apparently there are two cubs and a mom and they paid a visit to the motel and cause a commotion a few days earlier (a fellow traveler told us).
reviews.title: Basic But Good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a waste of $89 plus tax. The decor is dark and worn, there were dingy teddy bears on the beds, coffee maker but no condiments, outdated air conditioner, worn linens, not clean enough, needs refurbishing.
reviews.title: Scary Teddybears

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Stonybrook for 2 nights, Friday and Saturday. We stayed in the "Lodge" which was adjacent to the motel. It was a very nice and clean room. Small, but enough space to move around. The bathroom was very clean, especially the shower. The owner was pleasant, and complimentary breakfast in the morning was great. We couldn't get over how quiet it was in our room, even though we had a family with young kids staying right next door to us, we never heard them through the walls. Would definitely stay here again. Convenient location (we went up to hike Mt. Washington) and reasonable prices.
reviews.title: Peace and quiet in a beautiful location!

reviews.text: The Manager, Mike was incredibly cordial and accommodating. We stayed for one week (my husband and I) with another couple and the Manager helped us with refrigerator and freezer accommodations and just about made everything work for us during our stay. We stayed at the Motel from July 5th through and needed to check out early since one of our friends was ill. We received a complimentary gift certificate to compensate for the time lost.
reviews.title: Kudos to the Manager

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Mike makes the hotel worth going to and it would be difficult to appreciate this hotel without the amenities, cooperation, and absolute wonderful service that he provided. He deserves full credit for making our stay most enjoyable.
reviews.title: I'd pick more carefully next time

description: Voted #1 "Best Base For Touring Franconia Notch" New England Travel Guide. Stonybrook is a four season motel nestled in the heart of the White Mountains in the quaint village of Franconia with breathtaking views bordered by a sparkling alpine stream. You'll enjoy indoor and outdoor heated pools for year-round swimming,trout pond,game room and a cozy fireplace in our hand-timbered Lodge plus streamside picnic area with grills and winter iceskating. Only 2 miles to Cannon Mountain,Echo Lake and the Franconia Notch! Closest AAA motel to Cannon.
